awd_titl_txt: Monoclonal Antibodies against Mating Structures of          Chlamydomonas
awd_abstract_narration: This is a Research Opportunities for Women Career Advancement                 Award, to enable Dr. Forest to spend her sabbatical year                        producing monoclonal antibodies directed against surface                        components of the mating system in Chlamydomonas.  Dr. Forest has               developed and characterized an impressive collection of mating                  mutants in Chlamydomonas; however, it is quite clear that our                   understanding of the mating system is currently stymied by the                  lack of biochemical information about this process, and the                     genetic studies alone are not adequate to address the questions.                By obtaining these monoclonal antibodies, Dr. Forest will be in a               position to attack the problem biochemically, and make real                     progress in this fascinating area.
org_div_long_name: Division of Molecular and Cellular Biosciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: RESEARCH FOUNDATION OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK
